greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of edges in each rooted plane tree produced with the unranking algorithm presented in A075166, which is based on prime factorization.
comment: Each n occurs A000108(n) times in total.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For all n >= 2, a(n) = A055642(A075166(n))/2. [Half of the number of decimal digits in A075166(n).]
For all n >= 2, a(n) = A029837(1+A075165(n))/2. [Half of the binary width of A075165(n).]
For all n >= 1, a(n) = A000120(A075165(n)). [Thus also the binary weight of A075165(n), because half of the bits are zeros.]
xref: A253782 gives the positions where this sequence differs from A252464 (first time at n=16).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 13 2002
